DOC.brief_summary: after endoscopic submucosal dissection(ESD) of early gastric cancer, conventional proton pump(PPI) inhibitors and H2 receptor antagonists have a controversial effect on preventing bleeding from artificial ulcers. the aim of this study was to investigate whether a stronger acid suppression (high dose PPI) more effectively prevents bleeding after ESD
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Proton Pump Inhibitor and H2 Receptor Blocker on Prevention of Bleeding From Iatrogenic Ulcer After Endoscopic Submucosal Dissection for Gastric Neoplasms: A Prospective Randomized Controlled Trial
DOC.criteria: the patients who agreed informed consent gastric adenoma or early gastric cancer which is eligible for conventional ESD indication recent drug history of PPI, H2 rector antagonist, bismuth and antibiotics within 4 weeks recent drug history of anticoagulant or antiplatelet agent within 7 days s/p subtotal gastrectomy recurred gastric adenoma or cancer pregnant or breast feeding patients
